questions.question: ........................... someone gives me a lift, I won't be able to reach office on time.
I will come with you if you ...................................... for my drink.
questions.description: In first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: .......................... you don't wear a coat, you may catch a cold.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: I ........................... a cake if it is your birthday.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If she ............................. in Bangkok, she may visit her cousins.
I could buy a laptop, if I ................................. more money.
questions.description: In type 2 conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and could / would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If you ............................... the jackpot, what would you do?
You ................................. fewer health problems if you stop eating junk food.
If I hadn't broken my leg, I .................................... hiking with my cousins.
If you arrived early, you ................................. the show.
questions.description: In type 2 conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If she had called, I ...................................
questions.description: In type 3 conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.
